actions.title: Backup
actions.name: backup
actions.description: Action class for backup functions. Backs up a project and master data (forms, symbols, ...) to disk

parameters.name: TYPE
parameters.description: Type of task to be performed.

parameters.name: PROJECTNAME
parameters.description: Project name with full path (optional). If not entered, the selected project is used when the action is called from GUI (like from a script or ribbon bar). If called from the windows command line, the PROJECTNAME must be set or the ProjectAction must be used first (see also "ProjectAction"), otherwise an exception is thrown (see also "System.ArgumentException").

parameters.name: ARCHIVENAME
parameters.description: Archive name. Name of the file where the backed up data is to be saved (without path information).

parameters.name: DESTINATIONPATH
parameters.description: Target directory

parameters.name: COMMENT
parameters.description: Remark on backup (optional). The remark is written as a string to the corresponding property of the backed up project. Default = corresponding property is not set.

parameters.name: AUTOCOPYREFDATA
parameters.description: Specifies whether external files that are referenced by the project are copied to the project's directory (the "\DOC" and "\Images" subdirectories) before the backup. (optional, 0 = No, 1 = Yes). Default = 0. Valid only if TYPE parameter equals "PROJECT". Images and documents included in project are always backup-ed.

parameters.name: INCLEXTDOCS
parameters.description: Specifies whether documents are to be included in the backup (optional, 0 = No, 1= Yes). Default = 0

parameters.name: INCLIMAGES
parameters.description: Specifies whether image files are to be included in the backup (optional, 0 = No, 1=Yes). Default = 0

parameters.name: BACKUPMETHOD
parameters.description: Type of backup. "BACKUP": Project is backed up, "SOURCEOUT": Project is filed off, "ARCHIVE": Project is archived.

parameters.name: MDTYPE
parameters.description: Type of master data to be backed up. Options: "SYMBOLS", "MACROS", "FORMS", "ARTICLES", "LANGUAGES", "STANDARDSHEET", "STATIONDATA"

parameters.name: SOURCEPATH
parameters.description: Source directory, only applies to backup of master data.

parameters.name: FILENAME
parameters.description: Name of the file to be backed up. The file name can be entered with or without the complete path. The file extension must be specified. A file extension with a wildcard is also possible (for example: /FILENAME:*.fn1, /FILENAME:*.*, /FILENAME:*sh). This only applies to the backup of master data.

notes: Archive names of the form <some name>.nnn (n = a digit 0 - 9) are forbidden, because an archive name of this form (with a three-digit-extension) is automatically created when the backup file is split into several parts.
When an error occurs during a data backup operation, a "BaseException" is thrown.

examples.description: Backup project
Backup project with additional options
Backup project with specific project name
Backup master data (plot frame with full path)

actions.title: Change Layer
actions.name: changelayer
actions.description: Changes graphical layer properties.

parameters.name: PROJECTNAME
parameters.description: Project name with full path (optional). If not entered, the selected project is used when the action is called from GUI (like from a script or ribbon bar). If called from the windows command line, the PROJECTNAME must be set or the ProjectAction must be used first (see also "ProjectAction"), otherwise an exception is thrown (see also "System.ArgumentException").

parameters.name: LAYER[n]
parameters.description: Name of layer. Parameter name may be followed by a number.

parameters.name: VISIBLE[n]
parameters.description: The layer is visible (optional). Parameter name may be followed by a number.

parameters.name: PRINTED[n]
parameters.description: The layer is printed (optional). Parameter name may be followed by a number.

parameters.name: TEXTHEIGHT[n]
parameters.description: Specifies text height of layer (optional). Parameter name may be followed by a number.

parameters.name: COLORID[n]
parameters.description: Specifies color index of layer (0-255) (optional). Parameter name may be followed by a number.

parameters.name: TRANSPARENCY[n]
parameters.description: Specifies transparency of 3D layer as double with a value between 0.0 and 1.0 (optional). Parameter name may be followed by a number.

notes: It is possible to change properties of more than one layer in a single action call. First it is necessary to add the /LAYER parameter followed by a number - /LAYER1:EPLAN100, then each parameter should be followed by the same number /VISIBLE1:1 /COLORID1:10 etc.
In this way we can add the next layers to change - /LAYER2:EPLAN110 /VISIBLE2:1 /COLORID2:55 (...) /LAYER15:EPLAN200 /TEXTHEIGHT15:3.75. Please look at the example.

examples.description: Change layer properties
Change layer properties with project name
Change layer properties with transparency
Change multiple layer properties

actions.title: Check
actions.name: check
actions.description: Action class for checking functions: check a project and check pages.

parameters.name: TYPE
parameters.description: Type of task to be performed by the action.

parameters.name: PROJECTNAME
parameters.description: Project name with full path (optional). If not entered, the selected project is used when the action is called from GUI (like from a script or ribbon bar). If called from the windows command line, the PROJECTNAME must be set or the ProjectAction must be used first (see also "ProjectAction"), otherwise an exception is thrown (see also "System.ArgumentException").

parameters.name: VERIFICATIONSCHEME
parameters.description: Name of scheme used for the project check (optional, scheme name only, without path). Default value: Most recently used scheme.

parameters.name: VERIFYCOMPLETEDONLY
parameters.description: Verifies completed messages only, when set to 1. Default is 0. This parameter is only effective with the PROJECT and PARTS value of TYPE parameter, and without the PARTNUMBERn parameter.

parameters.name: USEPAGEFILTER
parameters.description: Determines if only filtered pages should be used or all project pages (optional). It corresponds to "Active" check box in GUI. Default value: 0

parameters.name: PAGENAME
parameters.description: Name of the page to be checked (optional).

parameters.name: SELn
parameters.description: Identifier of the pages to be Checked (optional), where n is a number (e.g. /SEL1:38/4/12/0 (result from StorableObject.ToStringIdentifier())) parameters are only effective with the PAGE value of the TYPE parameter.

parameters.name: PARTNUMBERn
parameters.description: Part number to be checked (optional), where n is a counter (e.g. /PARTNUMBER1:MyPartNumberA /PARTNUMBER2:MyPartNumberB

parameters.name: PARTVARIANTn
parameters.description: Part variant to be checked (optional), where n is a counter. Parameter is only effective with corresponding PARTNUMBER parameter (e.g. /PARTNUMBER1:MyPartNumberA /PARTVARIANT1:V2

parameters.name: INSTALLATIONSPACENAME
parameters.description: Name of the installation space to be checked. Value stored under property INSTALLATIONSPACE_DESIGNATION.

parameters.name: INSTALLATIONSPACENAMEn
parameters.description: Name of the installation space to be checked, where n is a number e.g. /INSTALLATIONSPACENAME1:BR1 /STRUCTURE1:=EB3+ET1 /INSTALLATIONSPACENAME2:BR2 /STRUCTURE2:=EB3+ET2 etc. Value stored under property INSTALLATIONSPACE_DESIGNATION.

parameters.name: STRUCTURE
parameters.description: Structure identifier of installation space to be checked. This parameter is only effective with the INSTALLATIONSPACE value of the TYPE parameter.

parameters.name: STRUCTUREn
parameters.description: Structure identifier of installation space to be checked, where n is a number e.g. /INSTALLATIONSPACENAME1:BR1 /STRUCTURE1:=EB3+ET1 /INSTALLATIONSPACENAME2:BR2 /STRUCTURE2:=EB3+ET2 etc. This parameter is only effective with the INSTALLATIONSPACE value of the TYPE parameter.

notes: If a page was explicitly entered by the PAGENAME parameter, then only this page is checked and the USEPAGEFILTER parameter is ignored.
If no specific page was explicitly entered by the PAGENAME parameter, project pages are determined.
If USEPAGEFILTER is set to 1, only pages filtered in GUI page navigator will be checked.
If USEPAGEFILTER is not used or if it is set to 0, all project pages will be checked. USEPAGEFILTER corresponds to "Active" check box in the page navigator.
If an error occurs during a check operation, a "BaseException" is thrown.

actions.title: Edit
actions.name: edit
actions.description: Action class for edit functions: open a project, open a page with a name, open a page with a device name and open a page with name and set the cursor at x y coordinates.

parameters.name: PROJECTNAME
parameters.description:
Project name with full path (optional).
If not entered, the selected project is used when the action is called from GUI (like from a script or the ribbon bar). 
If called from the windows command line, the PROJECTNAME must be set or the ProjectAction must be used first (see also "ProjectAction"), otherwise an exception is thrown (see also "System.ArgumentException").

parameters.name: PAGENAME
parameters.description: Name of the page to be opened(optional). Required if X, Y have been specified as parameters.

parameters.name: DEVICENAME
parameters.description: Name of an item (optional).

parameters.name: X
parameters.description: X coordinate (optional). Parameter is only valid if the PAGENAME parameter is available.

parameters.name: Y
parameters.description: Y coordinate (optional). Parameter is only valid if the PAGENAME parameter is available.

parameters.name: INSTALLATIONSPACE
parameters.description: Name of the installation space too be opened (optional). not possible to use with PAGENAME

parameters.name: DEVICENAME3D
parameters.description: Name of an item inside of an installation space (optional).

parameters.name: IGNOREWHENOPEN
parameters.description: if set to true or 1, action calling is ignored when a project is already open

notes:
The current action checks the parameters and execute the corresponding operation. One of the following operation will be done. 
The operation nÂ° 1 has a highest priority and the operation nÂ° 5 has the lowest priority. 
For example if a page   name and device name are set, so the operation nÂ° 1 will be executed. 
Otherwise it checks if it is possible to execute the remaining operations. 
If at all no parameter was set, soonly the project will be opened (operation nÂ° 5). 
1: Open a page with name and a device name. The device will be selected. If the given device was not found on the page, so the page will be opened and no element will be selected.  
   In this case an error message will be inserted into message system.  
2: Open a page with a name, X and Y coordinates.  
3: Open a page only with a name.  
4: Open a page which holds the  first device name found.  
5: Open a project. 
When an error occurs during an edit operation, a "BaseException" is thrown.

Open project:
edit /PROJECTNAME:C:\Projects\EPLAN\EPLAN_Sample_Project.elk

Open page:

edit /PROJECTNAME:C:\Projects\EPLAN\EPLAN_Sample_Project.elk /PAGENAME:=AP+ST1/7

Open page by a device tag of a device, which is located on the page:

edit /PROJECTNAME:C:\Projects\EPLAN\EPLAN_Sample_Project.elk /DEVICENAME:=AP+PT1-G1

Open page and set cursor to X, Y position:

edit /PROJECTNAME:C:\Projects\EPLAN\EPLAN_Sample_Project.elk /PAGENAME:=AP+ST1/7 /X:200 /Y:100

edit /PROJECTNAME:$(MD_PROJECTS)\EPLAN_Sample_Project.elk /INSTALLATIONSPACE:"=EB3+ET1 (-MP1)"

edit /PROJECTNAME:$(MD_PROJECTS)\EPLAN_Sample_Project.elk /DEVICENAME3D:=EB3+ET1-F14

actions.title: Export
actions.name: export
actions.description: Action to export pages and projects in graphical, DXF, DWG, PXF format.

parameters.name: TYPE
parameters.description:
Type of task to be performed by the action:
"PXFPROJECT": Export project in EPJ format.
"GRAPHICPROJECT": Export project in graphical format (TIF, GIF, PNG, JPG). 
"GRAPHICPAGE": Export pages in graphical format (TIF, GIF, PNG, JPG). 
"DXFPROJECT": Export project in DXF format.
"DWGPROJECT": Export project in DWG format. 
"DXFPAGE": Export page(s) in DXF format.
"DWGPAGE": Export page(s) in DWG format. 
"PDFPAGESSCHEME": Export pages in PDF format. Used together with PAGENAMEn parameters (e.g. /PAGENAME1:=AP+ST1/2 /PAGENAME2:=AP+ST1/4 /PAGENAME3:=AP+ST1/7 etc.) or SELn parameters (e.g. /SEL1:38/4/12/0 (result from StorableObject.ToStringIdentifier())). 
"PDFPROJECTSCHEME": Export project in PDF format.
"DXFDWGPROJECTSCHEME": Export a project in DXF or DWG format. All settings are read from scheme, also the DXF or DWG format."DXFDWGPPAGESSCHEME": Export pages in DXF or DWG format. All settings are read from scheme, also the DXF or DWG format. 
Used together with PAGENAMEn parameters (e.g. /PAGENAME1:=AP+ST1/2 /PAGENAME2:=AP+ST1/4 /PAGENAME3:=AP+ST1/7 etc.) or SELn parameters (e.g. /SEL1:38/4/12/0 (result from StorableObject.ToStringIdentifier())).

options.description: Export project in graphical format (TIF, GIF, PNG, JPG)
Export pages in graphical format (TIF, GIF, PNG, JPG)

Export pages in PDF format. Used together with PAGENAMEn parameters (e.g. /PAGENAME1:=AP+ST1/2 /PAGENAME2:=AP+ST1/4 /PAGENAME3:=AP+ST1/7 etc.) or SELn parameters (e.g. /SEL1:38/4/12/0 (result from StorableObject.ToStringIdentifier())).
Export a project in DXF or DWG format. All settings are read from scheme, also the DXF or DWG format

Export pages in DXF or DWG format. All settings are read from scheme, also the DXF or DWG format. Used together with PAGENAMEn parameters (e.g. /PAGENAME1:=AP+ST1/2 /PAGENAME2:=AP+ST1/4 /PAGENAME3:=AP+ST1/7 etc.) or SELn parameters (e.g. /SEL1:38/4/12/0 (result from StorableObject.ToStringIdentifier())).

parameters.name: PROJECTNAME
parameters.description:
Project name with full path (optional). 
If not entered, the selected project is used when the action is called from GUI (like from a script or ribbon bar). 
If called from the windows command line, the PROJECTNAME must be set or the ProjectAction must be used first (see also "ProjectAction"), otherwise an exception is thrown (see also "System.ArgumentException").

parameters.name: EXPORTFILE
parameters.description:
If the value of the TYPE parameter is "PXFPROJECT", then this parameter contains the name of the project to be exported (optional). 
Default value = Project name. 
If the TYPE parameter is set to "PDFPROJECTSCHEME" or "PDFPAGESSCHEME" then this parameter contains the name of the export file (required, full path name). 
The file extension is automatically added by the system.

parameters.name: EXPORTMASTERDATA
parameters.description:
Specifies whether master data is to be included in the export (optional, 0 = No, 1 = Yes). 
Default value = 1. This parameter is only effective with the following value of the TYPE parameter: "PXFPROJECT".

parameters.name: EXPORTCONNECTIONS
parameters.description:
Specifies whether connections are to be included in the export (optional, 0 = No, 1 = Yes). 
Default value = 0. This parameter is only effective with the following value of the TYPE parameter: "PXFPROJECT".

parameters.name: PAGENAME
parameters.description: Name of the page to be exported (optional). This parameter is only effective with the "DXFPAGE", "DXFPROJECT", "DWGPAGE", "DWGPROJECT", "GRAPHICPAGE", "GRAPHICPROJECT" values of the TYPE parameter.

parameters.name: PAGENAMEn
parameters.description: Names of the pages to be exported (optional), where n is a number (e.g. /PAGENAME1:=AP+ST1/2 /PAGENAME2:=AP+ST1/4 /PAGENAME3:=AP+ST1/7 etc.). These parameters are only effective with the "DXFPAGE", "DWGPAGE", "PDFPAGESSCHEME" values of the TYPE parameter.

parameters.name: DESTINATIONPATH
parameters.description:
Target directory (optional). Relevance of this parameter. 
For "GRAPHICPAGE", "GRAPHICPROJECT": Directory where the graphical files are stored. If this directory does not exist yet, it is created. 
Below this directory, a new directory with the name of the project is created into which the individual image files are saved. 
For "DXFPAGE", "DXFPROJECT", "DWGPAGE", "DWGPROJECT", Directory to which the data is exported. 
Default value = project directory. 
If used with parameter "PAGENAMEn", it is ignored and directory is taken from scheme.

parameters.name: FORMAT
parameters.description:
Output format (optional). Supported export formats are: 
â€¢ "BMP": available color depth: 1, 4, 8, 16, 24 and 32
â€¢ "TIF": available color depth: 1, 4, 8, 24 and 32
â€¢ "GIF": color depth is irrelevant 
â€¢ "PNG": available color depth: 1, 4, 8, 16, 24 and 32
â€¢ "JPG": available color depth: 1, 4, 8, 16, 24 and 32.
Default value = "TIF". This parameter is only effective with the "GRAPHICPAGE" and "GRAPHICPROJECT" values of the TYPE parameter.

parameters.name: COLORDEPTH
parameters.description: Color depth of the image (optional, default value = 24). The possible values are 1, 8, 16, 24, 32. This parameter is only effective with the "GRAPHICPAGE" and "GRAPHICPROJECT" values of the TYPE parameter.

parameters.name: IMAGEWIDTH
parameters.description: Image width in pixels (optional, default value = 80). The height is automatically computed from the page dimensions. This parameter is only effective with the "GRAPHICPAGE" and "GRAPHICPROJECT" values of then TYPE parameter.

parameters.name: IMAGECOMPRESSION
parameters.description: Type of compression for output in TIF format (optional). This parameter has no effect on other output formats. The color depth is always 1 for CCITT3, CCITT4, and RLE compression, that is, a binary image is created. The possible values are LZW, RLE, CCITT3, CCITT4, NONE. Default value = NONE. This parameter is only effective with the "GRAPHICPAGE" and "GRAPHICPROJECT" values of the TYPE parameter.

parameters.name: BLACKWHITE
parameters.description: Sets the color scheme for the output if the TYPE parameter has the value GRAPHICPAGE or GRAPHICPROJECT (optional, 0 = color, 1 = black and white). Default value : 1. Note: This does not affect the image format or size, i.e. the files are not reduced. It is only effective with the "GRAPHICPAGE" and "GRAPHICPROJECT" values of the TYPE parameter. This is also used for "PDFPROJECTSCHEME" and "PDFPAGESSCHEME" whereby 0 = Color, 1 = Black and White, 2 = Grayscale and 3 = White Inverted (output will be in Black and White; additionally white (Number: 8, 255, 263, 264, 266) graphical elements are inverted or changed to Black)

parameters.name: USEPAGEFILTER
parameters.description: Determines if only filtered pages should be used or all project pages (optional). It corresponds to "Active" check box in GUI. This parameter is only effective with the "GRAPHICPAGE" value of the TYPE parameter when PAGENAME or PAGENAMEn parameter is not used. Default value = 0

parameters.name: EXPORTSCHEME
parameters.description: Scheme for DXF/DWG export (optional). This parameter can be the users defined DXF/DWG export scheme settings (myScheme) or the default scheme settings of EPLAN (Standard Settings).  If this parameter does not exist or is empty (""), the most recently used DXF/DWG export scheme is taken. This parameter supports only the following values of the TYPE parameter: "DXFPAGE", "DXFPROJECT", "DWGPAGE", "DWGPROJECT", "PDFPROJECTSCHEME", and "PDFPAGESSCHEME".

parameters.name: USEZOOM
parameters.description: If set to 1, a zoom window is to be used when jumping from navigation pages to components in the PDF file. The components are then displayed centered within the zoom window.

parameters.name: ZOOMLEVEL
parameters.description: If USEZOOM is set to 1, you set in ZOOMLEVEL the desired zoom level in "mm". The value entered reflects the height of the screen section that is to be displayed magnified after the jump. A smaller value (e.g. 20 mm) thus leads to a greatly magnified display of the respective component on the screen. You can enter values between 1 and 3500. If USEZOOM is 0, ZOOMLEVEL has no influence on the result.

parameters.name: USESIMPLELINK
parameters.description: If set to 1, only a simple link is created in the PDF. If set to 0 then "three-way" jumps are available for all components in the PDF.

parameters.name: FASTWEBVIEW
parameters.description: If set to 1, fast web display will be enabled in the PDF.

parameters.name: READONLYEXPORT
parameters.description: If set to 1, the PDF file will be write protected.

parameters.name: USEPRINTMARGINS
parameters.description: If set to 1, print margins will be used during PDF export ignoring the setting in scheme (optional). If not passed, setting from scheme will be applied. This parameter is only effective with the "PDFPAGESSCHEME" and "PDFPROJECTSCHEME" values of the TYPE parameter.

parameters.name: TARGET
parameters.description: Specifies whether the target is disk or from Settings. It may have the following values: "Disk", "FromSettings" (case insensitive). If value is "FromSettings", the target for the export (also the target directory) is specified by the settings (schema). If value is "Disk", the target directory is specified by the DESTINATIONPATH parameter. (Note: If not specified, the target is disk. This option shouldn't be used; preserved for compatibility reasons only.). This parameter is only effective with the following values of the TYPE parameter: "DXFPROJECT", "DXFPAGE", "DWGPROJECT", "DWGPAGE". When exporting "DXFPAGE" or "DWGPAGE" with PAGENAMEn parameter, TARGET is automatically set to "FromSettings".

parameters.name: LANGUAGE
parameters.description: Language identifier. Specifies the language to translate the project into before the export. Note: This parameter is case-sensitive. Correct language specifiers are: "en_US", "de_DE", etc. This parameter is only effective with the following values of the TYPE parameter: "DXFPROJECT", "DXFPAGE", "DWGPROJECT", "DWGPAGE", "PDFPROJECTSCHEME" and "PDFPAGESSCHEME".

parameters.name: EXPORTMODEL
parameters.description: This is a boolean parameter. If true then any 3D models in the project will be exported along with the desired pages. Note that there are also settings in the schema that control which models will be exported. This parameter is only effective with the following values of the TYPE parameter: "PDFPROJECTSCHEME" and "PDFPAGESSCHEME".

notes:
The following functions are supported: 
â€¢ Export project in PXF format
â€¢ Export project and pages in graphical format (TIF, GIF, PNG, JPG)
â€¢ Export project and pages in DXF / DWG format
In case of EPJ project export (TYPE: "PXFPROJECT"), it is done with master data and without connections by default. So EXPORTMASTERDATA has "TRUE" value and EXPORTCONNECTIONS is "FALSE" by default.
If a page was explicitly entered by the PAGENAME parameter, only this page is exported and the USEPAGEFILTER parameter is ignored.

If no specific page was entered by the PAGENAME parameter, project pages are determined. If USEPAGEFILTER is set to 1, only pages filtered in GUI page navigator will be exported. If USEPAGEFILTER is not used or if it is set to 0, all project pages will be exported.
USEPAGEFILTER corresponds to "Active" check box in the page navigator.

In case of "DXFPAGE", "DXFPROJECT", "DWGPAGE", and "DWGPROJECT" export, if TARGET parameter is not specified, the output target is taken form the settings and the DESTINATIONPATH parameter is ignored.

In case of DXF/DWG and PDF exports this action internally calls the "ExportDataExchange" action with the following sets of parameters:
Action = 'RequestClearTargetDir', Target, ClearTargetDir
and 
Action = 'FileFinished', FullFileName, TargetDir, SubDir, FileName
When an error occurs during an export operation, a "BaseException" is thrown.

Target directory where the graphical files are stored. If this directory does not exist yet, it is created.

parameters.name: FORMAT
parameters.description:
Output format. Supported export formats are:
â€¢ BMP: available color depth: 1, 4, 8, 16, 24 and 32
â€¢ TIF: available color depth: 1, 4, 8, 24 and 32
â€¢ GIF: color depth is irrelevant
â€¢ PNG: available color depth: 1, 4, 8, 16, 24 and 32         
â€¢ JPG: available color depth: 1, 4, 8, 16, 24 and 32.
This parameter is optional. If not specified, a default value is taken from the scheme settings.

parameters.name: COLORDEPTH
parameters.description:
Color depth of the image.The possible values are 1, 8, 16, 24, 32.
This parameter is optional. If not specified, a default value is taken from the scheme settings.

parameters.name: IMAGEWIDTH
parameters.description:
Image width in pixels. The height is automatically  computed from the page dimensions. 
This parameter is optional. If not specified, a default value is taken from the scheme settings.

parameters.name: IMAGECOMPRESSION
parameters.description:
Type of compression for the output in Tiff format.
Possible values are LZW, RLE, CCITT3, CCITT4, NONE.
This parameter has no effect on other output formats.
The color depth is always 1 for CCITT3, CCITT4, and RLE compression, that is, a binary image is created.
This parameter is optional. If not specified, a default value is taken from the scheme settings.

parameters.name: BLACKWHITE
parameters.description:
The output is in black and white. Note: This does not affect the image format or size. 
This parameter is optional.
Default value: 1 (black/white)

parameters.description:
Determines if only filtered pages should be used or all project pages (optional).

Default value: 0.

notes: If a page was explicitly entered by the PAGENAME parameter, only this page is exported and the USEPAGEFILTER parameter is ignored.

â€¢ "PlcDcAMLExchangerGeneral" = Eplan Electric P8 AML-format
â€¢ "PlcDcXMLExchangerABB" = ABB Automation Builder
â€¢ "PlcDcXMLExchangerBandR" = B and R Automation Studio
â€¢ "PlcDcXMLExchangerRexroth" = Bosch Rexroth Indra Works
â€¢ "PlcDcXMLExchangerSchneider" = Schneider Unity Pro XL
â€¢ "PlcDcXMLExchangerSiemens" = Siemens SIMATIC STEP 7 5.6

parameters.description:

Possible values: 0 = No (default), 1 = Yes.
This parameter is only effective with the following values of the TYPE parameter: "BUSDATAEXPORT"

parameters.name: IMPORTMATCH
parameters.description:
Matching options for PLC data import. 
The import process tries to match imported objects with those existing in the project.
Based on the option selected, the matching may be performed by internal object ids or by objects' identifying names.
If an imported object is matched with an existing function, properties of the existing function will be updated whereas for unmatched imported objects, new functions will be created in the project.
The options are:
0 = Match by internal object ids.
1 = Match by identifying names. Note: in this case, a comparison dialog may be displayed for the user to individually selecting some function to update.
2 = Don't match. Create new functions for all imported objects.
This parameter is only effective with the following values of the TYPE parameter: "BUSDATAIMPORT"

parameters.name: OPENMODE
parameters.description: Specifies the mode in which the project is opened (optional). May have the following values: "Standard", "ReadOnly", "Exclusive".

notes: When status is set to "TRUE", value passed in Action parameter won't start in quiet mode.
Without parameter "Project" last opend project will be used.
When the OpenMode is specified, the project is opened in this mode or not opened at all, then an error is reported.
When the OpenMode is NOT specified, the system tries to open the project in Standard mode (readable and writable).
When the project needs an upgrade, it is opened in ReadOnly mode (or not opened at all, then an error is reported).
The actual open mode is added to the calling context with the parameter "OpenMode".

parameters.description: Identifying name of the user-defined property

parameters.description: "true" (1): edit inside of the hotspot cell allowed.

notes: You can replace the behavior from all properties in a property grid.
If you edit a property in a property grid, you get a hotspot button instead of the default control type.
If you click on the hotspot button, the given action will be started and you can modify the displayed value in a separate dialog with the given calling context.

Calling context of the registered Action are:
 * Parameters *
 
 PropertyId:           Property ID
 PropertyIndex:        Property Index
 PropertyIdentName:    Identifying name of user-defined property
 DbObjectId:           Object ID from the first data model
 Value:                Displayed string or multilanguage string
 

 * Return values *
 
 DialogModalResult:   1 for OK
 DialogModified:      1 (True) for modified
 Value:               new display value or new multilanguage string

actions.title: Renumber
actions.name: renumber
actions.description: Action corresponds to numbering functionality.

parameters.name: TYPE
parameters.description:
Type of task to be performed by the action.
"DEVICES": Renumber devices
"PAGES": Renumber pages
"TERMINALS": Renumbering terminals
"CABLES": Renumbering cables
"CONNECTIONS": Renumbering connections

parameters.name: PROJECTNAME
parameters.description:
Project name with full path (optional).
If not entered, the selected project is used when the action is called from GUI (like from a script or ribbon bar). 
If called from the windows command line, the PROJECTNAME must be set or the ProjectAction must be used first (see also "ProjectAction"), otherwise an exception is thrown (see also "System.ArgumentException").
This parameter is only effective with the following values of the TYPE parameter: "DEVICES", "PAGES", "TERMINALS", "CABLES", "CONNECTIONS".

parameters.name: USESELECTION
parameters.description:
If this flag is set, only the objects currently selected in GUI will be renumbered instead of all objects in the project (optional).
Possible values: 0 = No (default value), 1 = Yes.
This parameter is only effective with the following values of the TYPE parameter: "DEVICES", "PAGES", "TERMINALS", "CABLES", "CONNECTIONS".

parameters.name: FILTERSCHEME
parameters.description:
Name of the filter scheme (optional).
Default value: most recently used filter scheme. If this parameter is not available, then no filtering takes place.
This parameter is only effective with the following values of the TYPE parameter: "DEVICES".

parameters.name: CONFIGSCHEME
parameters.description:
Name of the configuration scheme (optional).
If not specified, the last used scheme will be selected again.
This parameter is only effective with the following values of the TYPE parameter: "DEVICES", "TERMINALS", "CABLES", "CONNECTIONS".

parameters.name: STARTVALUE
parameters.description:
Start value (integer, optional, default value: 1). 
This parameter is only effective with the following values of the TYPE parameter: "DEVICES", "PAGES", "TERMINALS", "CABLES".

parameters.name: STEPVALUE
parameters.description:
Increment value. (integer, optional, default value: 1). 
This parameter is only effective with the following values of the TYPE parameter: "DEVICES", "PAGES", "TERMINALS", "CABLES".

parameters.name: POSTNUMERATE
parameters.description:
If this flag is set, only invalid device tags (i.e. those containing "?" character) will be renumbered (optional).
Possible values: 0 = No, 1 = Yes (default value).
This parameter is only effective with the following values of the TYPE parameter: "DEVICES", "TERMINALS".

parameters.name: ALSONUMERATEDBYPLC
parameters.description:
If this flag is set, device tags which are influenced by PLC numbering will be numerated (optional).
Possible values: 0 = No (default value), 1 = Yes.
This parameter is only effective with the following values of the TYPE parameter: "DEVICES", "TERMINALS".

parameters.name: PERMITSORTCHANGE
parameters.description:
Permit sort change (optional).
Possible values: 0 = No (default value), 1 = Yes.
This parameter is only effective with the following values of the TYPE parameter: "TERMINALS".

parameters.name: FILLGAPS
parameters.description:
Fill Gaps (optional). 
Possible values: 0 = No (default value), 1 = Yes.
This parameter is only effective with the following values of the TYPE parameter: "TERMINALS".

parameters.name: IDENTIFIER
parameters.description:
Identifier, e.g. "X*" (optional). 
If used, all devices from the project matching the identifier are taken for renumeration regardless of whether the USESELECTION parameter is used or not.
This parameter is only effective with the following values of the TYPE parameter: "DEVICES".

parameters.name: NUMERATECABLES
parameters.description:
If this flag is set, cables whose device tags contain source and target information are also numerated (optional).
Possible values: 0 = No (default value), 1 = Yes.
This parameter is only effective with the following values of the TYPE parameter: "DEVICES".

parameters.name: STRUCTUREORIENTED
parameters.description:
Set this parameter to true to provide numbering per structure identifier.
If false, then pages are continuously numbered without accounting for the structure identifiers.
This parameter is only effective with the following values of the TYPE parameter: "PAGES".

parameters.name: KEEPINTERVAL
parameters.description:
In combination with the definition of the start page, this parameter retains the increments between the selected pages for the target pages.
In this way you can move any desired number of selected pages by a specified increment.
Entering the increment size is not possible in this case.
This parameter is only effective with the following values of the TYPE parameter: "PAGES".

parameters.name: KEEPTEXT
parameters.description:
Set this to 1, if the alphabetic part of the page name should not be overwritten.
This parameter is only effective with the following values of the TYPE parameter: "PAGES".

parameters.name: SUBPAGES
parameters.description:
Values are:
0 = Retain: Existing subpages are adopted unchanged into the target page.
1 = ConsecutiveNumbering: Existing subpages are renumbered using the starting value "1" and an increment of "1".
        At every change of the main page, the subpage numbering begins again from "1".
        The subpage numbering follows the project settings defined in the project setting "Characters for subpages".
2 = ConvertIntoMainPages: Subpages are converted to main pages and renumbered.
This parameter is only effective with the following values of the TYPE parameter: "PAGES".

parameters.name: PREFIX
parameters.description:
Prefix.
This parameter is only effective with the following values of the TYPE parameter: "TERMINALS".

parameters.name: SUFFIX
parameters.description:
Suffix.
This parameter is only effective with the following values of the TYPE parameter: "TERMINALS".

parameters.name: SEQUENCE
parameters.description:
Mode to use for numbering. Values are:
0 = Like sorting: The terminal / pin sorting sequence displayed under terminal strips - (project name) or plugs - (project name) is used.
Select this option if you would like to number existing terminals / pins but retain the existing sorting.
1 = Page oriented
2 = Cable oriented
3 = Level oriented

parameters.name: EXTENT
parameters.description:
Parameter to define the scope of numbering. Values are:
0 = Selected - only the selected terminals or pins will be numbered.
1 = All selected terminal strips - all terminals of the same strip as selected terminal will be numbered.

parameters.name: POTENTIAL_N
parameters.description:
Parameter to determine how N terminals will be treated during numbering. Values are:
0 = Ignore
1 = Do not modify, include in sequence. PE, N or SH terminals are not modified during numbering but are taken into account when numbering the other terminals.
        This means that the designations of the other terminals are assigned as though the PE, N or SH terminals were being included in the numbering.
2 = Renumber

options.description: Do not modify, include in sequence

parameters.name: POTENTIAL_PE
parameters.description:
Parameter to determine how PE terminals will be treated during numbering. Values are:
0 = Ignore
1 = Do not modify, include in sequence. PE, N or SH terminals are not modified during numbering but are taken into account when numbering the other terminals.
        This means that the designations of the other terminals are assigned as though the PE, N or SH terminals were being included in the numbering.
2 = Renumber

options.description: Do not modify, include in sequence

parameters.name: POTENTIAL_SH
parameters.description:
Parameter to determine how SH terminals will be treated during numbering. Values are:
0 = Ignore
1 = Do not modify, include in sequence. PE, N or SH terminals are not modified during numbering but are taken into account when numbering the other terminals.
        This means that the designations of the other terminals are assigned as though the PE, N or SH terminals were being included in the numbering.
2 = Renumber

options.description: Do not modify, include in sequence

parameters.name: MULTIPLETERMINALS
parameters.description:
Also renumber multi path terminals. Values are:
0 = Don't modify - terminals with the property "Allow same designations" are ignored during numbering.
1 = Number same - terminals with the same designation with the "Allow same designations" property are given the same number.
2 = Number individually - terminals with the "Allow same designations" property are each given their own number.
        Therefore, multiple terminals which had the same number before numbering will have different numbers after numbering.

parameters.name: KEEPALPHA
parameters.description:
Keep alphabetical elements of the terminal number. Values are:
0 = Don't modify - terminals or pins with alphabetical elements in the designation are ignored during numbering.
1 = Keep alphabetical elements - the alphabetical elements of the terminal or pin designation are retained. The first numeric elements are renumbered. If the designation only has alphabetical elements, the old designation is attached to the new numbering. Sequential terminals with different counters but the same numerical component receive the same numerical component in the counter even after the numbering. 
2 = Number - all terminals / pins are renumbered. In doing so, the old designation is overwritten.

parameters.name: KEEPEXISTING
parameters.description:
Keep existing cable DTs (optional). 
Possible values: 0 = No (default value), 1 = Yes. 
0 = Renumber all of the cable DTs.
1 = Renumber only newly generated or copied cables. The DT of the already numbered cables is retained. The cables with "?" character in the identifier will be numbered.

parameters.name: KEEPIDENTIFIER
parameters.description:
Keep the identifier (optional).
Possible values: 0 = No (default value), 1 = Yes. 
0 = Overwrite the identifiers of the cables with the identifier from the identifier set that is used during numbering.
1 = Renumber existing cables and only reassign the counters. The identifier of the already numbered cables remains. The character "?" at the beginning of the identifier is not retained.

parameters.name: STARTVALUE_n
parameters.description:
Start value. Where n is a connection group number (1,2,3...).
This parameter is only effective with the following values of the TYPE parameter: "CONNECTIONS".

parameters.name: STEPVALUE_n
parameters.description:
Step value. Where n is a connection group number (1,2,3...).
This parameter is only effective with the following values of the TYPE parameter: "CONNECTIONS".

parameters.name: GROUP_n
parameters.description:
Group parameter. Where n is a connection group number (1,2,3...).
This parameter is only effective with the following values of the TYPE parameter: "CONNECTIONS".

parameters.name: OVERWRITE
parameters.description:
Overwrite mode. Values are:
0 = All - always overwrite.
1 = ExceptManuals - overwrite all except those, which are marked as "manually set". 
2 = None - never overwrite.
This parameter is only effective with the following values of the TYPE parameter: "CONNECTIONS".

parameters.name: AVOIDIDENTICALDESIGNATIONS
parameters.description:
Values are:
0 = In entire project
1 = In the selection
2 = None
3 = Per counter reset range (structure/page)

parameters.name: VISIBILITY
parameters.description:
Visiblity. Values are:
0 = All visible
1 = Do not modify
2 = Once per page and range

parameters.name: MARKASMANUAL
parameters.description: Mark as "manually set". This parameter is only effective with the following values of the TYPE parameter: "CONNECTIONS".

examples.description: Numbering devices with a specific configuration scheme
Numbering devices with selection and specific settings
Numbering pages with specific settings
Numbering cables with specific settings
Numbering cables with specific settings
Numbering cables with specific settings
Numbering connections with specific settings
Numbering connections with specific settings
Numbering terminals with specific settings

actions.title: Reports
actions.name: reports
actions.description: Action class to update all project evaluations.

parameters.name: TYPE
parameters.description:
Type of task to be performed by the action:
"PROJECT": Generate project reports.
"PAGES": Update all reports of the same type as given pages. Only the particular report, to which the page belongs, will be updated
"UPDATEMODELVIEWPAGES": Update model views on given pages.
"CREATEMODELVIEWS": Create model views
"CREATECOPPERUNFOLDS": Create copper unfolds
"CREATEDRILLINGVIEWS": Create drilling views

options.description: Update all reports of the same type as given pages
Update model views on given pages

parameters.name: PROJECTNAME
parameters.description:
Project name with full path (optional).
If not entered, the selected project is used, in case the action is called from GUI (like from a script or ribbon bar). 
If called from the windows command line, the PROJECTNAME must be set or the ProjectAction must be used first (see also "ProjectAction"), otherwise an exception is thrown (see also "System.ArgumentException").

parameters.name: PAGENAME
parameters.description:
Name of the page to be updated (optional).
If specified, only the particular report, to which the page belongs, will be updated.
This parameter is only effective with the "PAGES" and "UPDATEMODELVIEWPAGES" values of the TYPE parameter.

parameters.name: USEPAGEFILTER
parameters.description:
Determines if only filtered pages should be used or all project pages (optional). 
It corresponds to "Active" check box in GUI. 
These parameters are only effective with the "PAGES" and "UPDATEMODELVIEWPAGES" values of the TYPE parameter.
Default value: 0

parameters.name: PAGEFILTERNAME
parameters.description:
Pages are read from pagefilter with the name pagefiltername.
These parameters are only effective with the "PAGES" and "UPDATEMODELVIEWPAGES" values of the TYPE parameter.

parameters.name: PAGENAMEn
parameters.description:
Names of the pages to be  included in reports update (optional), where n is a number e.g. /PAGENAME1:=AP+ST1/2 /PAGENAME2:=AP+ST1/4 /PAGENAME3:=AP+ST1/7 etc.
These parameters are only effective with the "PAGES" and "UPDATEMODELVIEWPAGES" values of the TYPE parameter.

parameters.name: SELn
parameters.description: Identifier of the pages to be included in report update (optional), where n is a number (e.g. /SEL1:38/4/12/0 (result from StorableObject.ToStringIdentifier())) parameters are only effective with the "PAGES" and "UPDATEMODELVIEWPAGES" values of the TYPE parameter.

parameters.name: TEMPLATEn
parameters.description: Templates used for generating report pages, where n is a number e.g. /TEMPLATE1:"Template1" /TEMPLATE2:"Template2" etc. These parameters are only effective with "CREATEMODELVIEWS", "CREATECOPPERUNFOLDS" and "CREATEDRILLINGVIEWS" value of the TYPE parameter.

parameters.name: REPLACEEXISTING
parameters.description:
Replaces existing model views, copper unfolds or drilling views when set to 1.
This parameter is only effective with "CREATEMODELVIEWS", "CREATECOPPERUNFOLDS" and "CREATEDRILLINGVIEWS" value of the TYPE parameter.

notes: When an error occurs during a reports operation, a "BaseException" is thrown.

examples.description: Generate project reports

actions.title: XCabCalculateEnclosureTotalWeightAction
actions.name: XCabCalculateEnclosureTotalWeightAction
actions.description: Calculates the total weight of a cabinet and writes it to the "Total weight" property (#36108 - FUNCTION3D_CABINET_TOTALWEIGHT)

parameters.name: ProjectName
parameters.description:
Project name with full path (optional input parameter for the "All cabinets" mode).
When the specified project is not open, this action opens it and closes it automatically after this action is executed.
If the project is invalid, the current project will be used.

parameters.name: DatabaseId
parameters.description:
Database ID of the project to be used (optional input parameter for the "All cabinets" mode).
When using this parameter, the project must be opened in P8 beforehand. If the project is invalid, the current project will be used.
If the ProjectName parameter is specified, the DatabaseId parameter is not taken into account.

parameters.name: CabinetTotalWeight
parameters.description: Total weight of a single cabinet (optional output parameter for the "One cabinet" mode). If the mode is "One cabinet", this parameter contains the result of the calculation.

notes:
"All cabinets" mode:
If a project is specified in the calling context (parameter "ProjectName" or parameter "DatabaseId" is set), all weights of all cabinets in the project are calculated.
The results are stored in the "Total weight" property (#36108 - FUNCTION3D_CABINET_TOTALWEIGHT) of each cabinet.
If no project is specified in the calling context, the currently selected project is being used.

"One cabinet" mode:
As an alternative to setting the ProjectName or DatabaseId, a single Cabinet object can be passed through a special DMBaseHandleContext.
In this case, only the total weight of this cabinet will be calculated.
In this mode, the "Total weight" property (#36108 - FUNCTION3D_CABINET_TOTALWEIGHT) is not set,
instead the result is set in the calling context to the output parameter "CabinetTotalWeight".
For the "One cabinet" mode, the project must be opened in P8 beforehand.

examples.description: Calculate the total weight of all cabinets in the project
Calculate the total weight of all cabinets in a specific project
Calculate the total weight of a single cabinet (One cabinet mode)

actions.title: XCCreateGravingtextAction
actions.name: XCCreateGravingtextAction
actions.description:
Generates an engraving text from the DTs of the source and target of the cable.
By default, the designation is abbreviated in accordance with the VASS standard (Volkswagen Audi Seat Skoda),
i.e., structure identifiers having the same name of source and target are removed - starting from the left.

parameters.name: Complete
parameters.description:
Retain mounting locations of the same name (optional, 0 = No, 1 = Yes). Default = 0
If the parameter is not specified or set to 0, the designation is truncated in accordance with the VASS standard (Volkswagen Audi Seat Skoda),
i.e., structure identifiers having the same name of source and target are removed - starting from the left.
If this parameter is set to 1, mounting locations of the same name for the source and target remain.

notes: The project structure must conform to the VASS standard so that the abbreviation rules are executed correctly.

examples.description: Generate engraving text with truncated designation
Generate engraving text without truncation of designation

parameters.name: Quiet

notes: Removes unnecessary net definition points of active project, i.e. net definition points that contain connections equal to the connections that would be in the net without using net based wiring but using target based wiring.
If necessary, connection definition points are placed on the connections of the net so that connection properties don't get lost.

actions.description: Standard action to find symbol references for inserting.

parameters.name: SymbolLibName
parameters.description: Name of the symbol library where the symbol is to find

parameters.name: SymbolId
parameters.description: Number of the symbol that should be inserted

parameters.name: VariantId
parameters.description: Number of the variant, if the symbol has one

parameters.name: FDT
parameters.description: Identifier of the function definition tag to search the symbol that should be inserted

parameters.name: PlacementMode
parameters.description:
Identifier of placement mode to search the symbol that should be inserted.
String which defines the placement type of the symbol.
The placement mode depends on the DocumentType

parameters.name: SymbolType
parameters.description: Identifier of symbol type to search the symbol that should be inserted

parameters.name: CustomSymbolSetting
parameters.description:
This parameter should be used if a user-created symbol should be inserted.
The parameter is the name of the setting which contains the identifiers of the custom symbol.
If this parameter is NOT empty, the custom symbol is used and not the symbol referenced by "SymbolLibName", "SymbolId", "VariantId".
The setting itself must contain these values and look like this:
XSbGui.CustomSymbols.CustomSymbols.lib
XSbGui.CustomSymbols.CustomSymbols.id
XSbGui.CustomSymbols.CustomSymbols.var

notes: This action only works correctly when the GUI is initialized.
If the symbol is not found, a window with symbols is opened.
Can be used with all types of symbol variants, function definition tags, symbol data and symbol references.
The action can be used only interactively.
Used specialized calling context: DMBaseHandleContext

actions.title: XGedUpdateMacroAction
actions.name: XGedUpdateMacroAction
actions.description:
Updates macros.
It can be passed the full path of a project. When project is not opened, this action opens it and closes it automatically.

parameters.name: ProjectName
parameters.description: The full path of project (optional). When project specified by ProjectName is not open, this action opens it and closes it automatically.

parameters.name: CONFIGSCHEME
parameters.description: Defines a concrete scheme to use (optional when called from a command line). If not given, last used scheme name is used.

parameters.name: AUTOMATIC
parameters.description: Applies the last used record for several placeholders automatically (optional), overwrites value of scheme.

parameters.name: REPLACEVARIANT
parameters.description: Allows replacement of one macro variant to another variant of same macro.

notes: If no path is passed, action takes selected object in GED. Object can be a macrobox or an object of macrobox.
Alternatively, an object can be passed by a special DMBaseHandleContext.
This object can be also a macrobox, an object of macrobox or a project.

examples.description: Update macros using the selected object in GED
Update macros using the full path of a project (absolute)
Update macros using the full path of a project (absolute without file extension)
Update macros using the full path of a project (relative to standard-folder)
Update macros using the full path of a project (relative to standard-folder)
Update macros using the full path of a project (relative to standard-folder without file extension)
Update macros using the full path of a project in scripting (absolute)
examples.code:
CommandLineInterpreter oCommandLineInterpreter = new CommandLineInterpreter();
bool bRet = oCommandLineInterpreter.Execute("XGedUpdateMacroAction /ProjectName:\"C:\My Folder\MyProject.elk\"");

actions.title: XMActionDCCommonExport
actions.name: XMActionDCCommonExport
actions.description: Starts the export for the external editing.

parameters.name: DatabaseId
parameters.description:
The database ID of one project (optional).
If not entered, the ProjectName parameter is used.

parameters.name: ProjectName
parameters.description:
The full path of project (optional).
When project specified by ProjectName is not open, this action opens it and closes it automatically after this action is executed.
If not entered, the selected project is used when the action is called from GUI (like from a script or ribbon bar).

parameters.name: COMPLETEPROJECT
parameters.description: The whole project is exported, not only the selected objects (0 = No, 1 = Yes).

parameters.name: CONFIGSCHEME
parameters.description:
Configuration scheme (optional).
If this parameter is not set, a dialog asking for the configuration scheme is displayed.

parameters.name: LANGUAGE
parameters.description: Language (e.g. "en_US", "??_??" - all languages, etc).

parameters.name: DESTINATION
parameters.description:
Target file where the export results are saved.
The following formats are supported: TXT, XLSX, XML. Format must be set according to the extension in CONFIGSCHEME.

parameters.name: EXECUTIONMODE
parameters.description:
0 = Export,
1 = Export and edit,
2 = Edit and return

parameters.name: AUTOIMPORT
parameters.description:
After edit no question appears to import the data (optional, 0 = No, 1 = Yes).
Default value = 0
This only applies to ExecutionMode = 2.

examples.description: Export the project data to an Excel file

options.description: Objects are identified by name instead

notes:
These 2 modes are meant for different workflows/use-cases:
If you export data from the parts management, change them and import them into the same parts database, then identifying the objects by object ID is the right mechanism for identification and it is possible to change the identifying name of the objects (for example the part number).

If you want to import data from a different data source, for example a file generated from a connection to an ERP system, you usually don't have an object ID of EPLAN. In this case, use the identifying name to import the data.

If you import by name, you still need to specify part of the object ID in the first column - the type of the object, to define if the data contains for example a part, an address or an accessory list.

The supported main types are:
117 = part
156 = drilling pattern
157 = connection point pattern
213 = accessory list
226 = accessory placement
135 = address

The import supports not only main types, but also their subtypes. Since they have no identifying name, but are identified as subobjects of the main object, they have to be defined in the second column in the format "99 (117:99/1)", where the first 99 is the subtype and in brackets is the relation: Containing a main object, the relation and its index.

So "99 (117:99/1)" means that it is a function template (first 99), and is related to a part (117), where it is the first index in the parts function templates. Sub-objects must follow main objects in the imported file.

Valid subtypes are:
For a part:
99  = function template
85  = module/assembly position
224 = drilling patterns
215 = accessory
242 = safety related values
For a drilling pattern:
158 = cut-out
For a connection point pattern:
159 = connection point
For an accessory list:
214 = accessory list entry
For an accessory placement:
227 = accessory placement entry
This allows the properties of articles to be changed.
The data configuration file can be created e.g. via the menu item "Utilities > Edit properties externally > Export functionsâ€¦"

examples.description: Import data configuration file to an existing EPLAN article database

parameters.name: srcdb
parameters.description: Path or connection string of the source database (V2022) (input parameter, mandatory)

parameters.name: destdb
parameters.description:
Connection string of the destination database. Format: server|catalog|logintype|username|pwd
Login type. Possible values are:
0 = Windows authentication
1 = SQL authentication (encrypted password)
2 = SQL authentication (non - encrypted password)
username and pwd are optional for logintype = 0.
server - name of the server
catalog - name of the database
username - user name
pwd - password for access

parameters.name: SharedSource
parameters.description:
If this parameter is 1, the source database is opened shared.
Otherwise, the database is opened exclusively (input parameter, optional)

parameters.name: SharedDestination
parameters.description:
If this parameter is 1, the destination database is opened shared.
Otherwise, the database is opened exclusively (input parameter, optional)

parameters.name: CompleteSync
parameters.description:
If this parameter is 1, all parts are synchronized. In source database missing parts are deleted in destination database.
Otherwise, only changes after the last timestamp are synchronized (input parameter, optional)

notes: The first call will synchronize the whole database. All further calls only adjust the changes since the last call.

actions.title: XPamsDeviceSelectionAction
actions.name: XPamsDeviceSelectionAction
actions.description: Selects device or updates device information. This object can be a project/function/connection.

parameters.name: ProjectName
parameters.description:
The full path of project (optional). When project specified by ProjectName is not open, this action opens it and closes it automatically.
If nothing is entered, the selected project will be used if the action is to be run over the user interface (e.g. via script or the toolbar).
When executing from the Windows command line, ProjectName must be specified or ProjectAction has to be used before that. Otherwise a system message will appear.

parameters.name: Mode
parameters.description:
Mode (optional)
Supported modes are:
â€¢ selectDevice (default value): Selects a new device for the existing objects.
In the process all device data including the part reference data is deleted and reassigned in accordance with the device selection.
â€¢ updateDevice : Updates only the device data of the parts of the existing objects. The part numbers and part reference data are retained.

options.description: Selects a new device for the existing objects
Updates only the device data of the parts of the existing objects

parameters.name: KeepSwapped
parameters.description:
This parameter specifies if swapped connection point designations or wire colors (relative to the order in
the function templates) will be kept (optional). It is only effective, if all connection point designations or wire colors will match as a set.

notes: The functionality corresponds to the update device data context menu item in the bill of materials navigator.
It can be passed the full path of a project. When project is not opened, this action opens it and closes it automatically.
Alternatively, an object can be passed by a special DMBaseHandleContext.

actions.title: XPrjActionUpgradeProjects
actions.name: XPrjActionUpgradeProjects
actions.description: This action upgrades one or more projects to the actual database scheme version.

parameters.name: Project
parameters.description:
Full project link file name
All projects in the folder and its subfolders are upgraded.

parameters.name: Archive
parameters.description: true: ZW1 projects are also upgraded and packed afterwards.

parameters.name: BaseProject
parameters.description: true: ZW9 and ZX1 projects are also upgraded and packed afterwards.

parameters.name: UpgradeWriteProtectedProjects
parameters.description: true: ReadOnly projects are also upgraded (*.elr and *.elt, *.els, elx).

parameters.name: FileTypes
parameters.description:
true: Projects / basic projects in XML format are also upgraded (*.ept and *.epj, *.zx2).
*.*: All projects (such as *.elk, *.ell, *.elp, *.elr, *.elt, *.els, *.elx, *.zw1, *.zw9, *.zx1, *.ept, *.epj, *.zx2).

parameters.name: UpdateConnections
parameters.description: true: The original projects will be packed into a 7zip file after upgrade (default = true).

parameters.name: DoDataModelUpgrades
parameters.description: true: The connections in the project will be updated (default = false). Note: If the DoDataModelUpgrades parameter is false, this value will be ignored.

parameters.name: CreateBackup
parameters.description: true: No backup of the old version is created (default = false).

parameters.name: IgnoreBackupProjects
parameters.description: true: Backup projects will be ignored when converting a complete folder (default = false). Backup projects have a naming like [NAME]_V[Version]_[Backuptime].

parameters.name: DoDataModelCorrections
parameters.description: true: Also data model corrections will be done (default = true). Note: If this parameter is set to false, the UpdateConnections parameter will be ignored.

parameters.name: DataBackupDescriptionMode
parameters.description:
0: Default, will add new data backup description at the end.
1: Data backup description will not change.
2: Replace data backup description with new one.

notes: The action does nothing when no upgrade is needed. (Except for XML formats).
Several input formats are provided: a project in ZW1 format is upgraded and packed to ZW1 again.
All projects in a folder are upgraded (recursively).
A backup of every project is done before changing.
Basic projects are only upgraded when a major version change is done. For minor changes the basic project will stay unchanged.
Each project found produces a system message with the upgrade result.

Handle Folder:
All *.elk, *.ell and *.elp are upgraded.
When the FileTypes parameter is set, the following parameters are ignored: Archive, BaseProject, UpgradeWriteProtectedProjects.

examples.description: Upgrade the project EPLAN_Sample_Project.elk located in the projects directory

16 = kJicSpecialLeft (Special Attachment-Types for PathTexts in JIC-Project),
17 = kJicSpecialCenter (Should not be used in new projects, just to be compatible to E5),
18 = kJicSpecialRight

parameters.name: angle
parameters.description:
Angle to the X-axis in Â° (optional).
Possible values are: 0Â°, 45Â°, 90Â°, 135Â°, 180Â°, -45Â°, -90Â°, -135Â°

parameters.name: font
parameters.description:
Text font (optional).
Possible values are:
0 = font 1 of company settings,
1 = font 2 of company settings,
...,
9 = font 10 of company settings

parameters.name: visible
parameters.description:
Text visibility (optional).
Possible values are: 0 = invisible, 1 = visible, 2 = from layer

parameters.name: bold
parameters.description: Text accentuation (optional). Possible values are: 0 = normal, 1 = bold

parameters.name: italic
parameters.description: Text accentuation (optional). Possible values are: 0 = normal, 1 = italic

parameters.name: underline
parameters.description: Text accentuation (optional). Possible values are: 0 = normal, 1 = underlined

parameters.name: showtextbox
parameters.description:
Defines whether to use a text box (optional).
Possible values are:
0 = no text box
1 = rectangular text box
2 = elliptic text box
3 = from layer
4 = Oval text box

parameters.name: setframeactive
parameters.description:
Defines whether there should be an activate frame (optional). Possible values are:
0 = should not be active,
1 = should be active

parameters.name: showframe
parameters.description:
Defines whether to show a frame (optional). Possible values are:
0 = no alignment box,
1 = show alignment box

parameters.name: framewidth
parameters.description: Frame width in mm or In (optional).

parameters.name: frameheight
parameters.description: Frame height in mm or In (optional).

parameters.name: adjustframe
parameters.description:
Adjustment of frame (optional).
1 = do not fit in,
16 = Text: width fixed - never word-wrap,
32 = Text: height fixed - never word-wrap,
64 = Text: word-wrap,
80 = Text: width fixed - word-wrap,
128 = Text: remove line breaks,
144 = Text: width fixed - never word-wrap - remove line breaks,
208 = Text: width fixed - word-wrap - remove line breaks

parameters.name: sizefromsettings
parameters.description:
Defines whether to use the frame size from the project settings (optional).
Possible values are: 0 = should not be activated, 1 = should be active

parameters.name: leaderline
parameters.description: Defines whether to activate a leader line (optional). Possible values are: 0 = should not be active, 1 = should be active

parameters.name: donttranslate
parameters.description: Defines whether to translate automatically (optional). Possible values are: 0 = text is translated automatically, 1 = text is not translated automatically

parameters.name: linespacing
parameters.description: Row spacing in number of lines (optional).

parameters.name: layer
parameters.description: Layer name (optional). Example: "EPLAN501"

notes: In properties which should not be changed, simply leave a question mark ("?").
The settings are the same as in the characteristic text dialog.

Changes height, angle, font and shows a frame:

  XGedStartInteractionAction /Name:XGedIaFormatText /height:3.5 /angle:-90 /font:2 /setframeactive:1 /showframe:1 /framewidth:20 /frameheight:10 /adjustframe:208

Changes the layer to "EPLAN501" and sets height and color to the new layer's standard:

  XGedStartInteractionAction /Name:XGedIaFormatText /height:-16002 /color:-16002 /layer:EPLAN501

parameters.name: filename
parameters.description: Filename of macro that should be inserted. If this parameter is empty, a file selection dialog opens.

parameters.name: variant
parameters.description:
Variant of macro that should be inserted. Value range [0-15]
 0  - variant A
  1  - variant B
  2  - variant C
 3  - variant D
 4  - variant E
   5  - variant F
                                        6  - variant G
                                        7  - variant H
                                        8  - variant I
                                        9  - variant J
                                        10 - variant K
                                        11 - variant L
                                        12 - variant M
                                        13 - variant N
                                        14 - variant O
                                        15 - variant P

parameters.name: RepresentationType
parameters.description:
Representation type of macro that should be inserted. Value range [1-13]
  1 - MultiLine
  2 - SingleLine
                                        3 - PairCrossReference
                                        4 - Overview
                                        5 - Graphics
                                        6 - ArticlePlacement
                                        7 - PI_FlowChart
                                        8 - Fluid_MultiLine
                                        9 - Cabling
                                        10 - ArticlePlacement3D
                                        11 - Functional
                                        12 - Planning
                                        12 - FluidFunctionalOverview

parameters.name: AskForNumeration
parameters.description:
Specifies whether to display or suppress a dialog asking for the numeration (optional).
Possible values are: true = show dialog asking for the numeration (default value), false = suppress asking for numeration

parameters.name: NumberModus
parameters.description:
Numeration mode (optional).
Possible values are: 0 = don't modify, 1 = number, 2 = number using flag "?", 3 or -1 = show dialog asking for the numeration mode

parameters.name: RenumberPrefixes
parameters.description:
Specifies whether to renumber the prefixes (optional). Can only be set if "NumberModus" = 1.
Possible values are: true = renumber prefixes, false = don't renumber prefixes (default value)

XML converters.name: XML Converters
XML converters.description: This is the list of the available XML converters, which can be used in import and export methods. They are divided on categories

XML converters.title: Category DeviceListXmlConverter
XML converters.name: DeviceListXmlConverter
XML converters.description: Imports or exports data of a device list (see ribbon "Devices" > "Navigator" > "Device list" > context menu).

XML converters.name: XDLCsvCommaSepImporterExporter
XML converters.description: Imports or exports device list data in comma separated CSV format.
